items.title: Unicode IVS handling
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
When converting strings with IVS: Ideograph Variation Selector, unihandecode does not convert correctly.

**Related issue**
(if exist)

**To Reproduce**
A following test become failure.
```
def test_ivs():
    s1 =  "\U0000845B\U000E0100飾区"
    s2  = "\U0000845B\U000E0101城"
    u = unihandecode.Unihandecoder('ja')
    r1 = u.decode(s1)
    r2 = u.decode(s2)
    assert r1.startswith('katsu')
    assert r2.startswith('katsura')
    assert r1 == 'katsushika ku'
    assert r2 == 'katsuragi'
```
\U0000845B\U000E0100飾区 is a variation of 葛飾区 and \U0000845B\U000E0101城 is a variation of 葛城 which is used in location name 葛城市

**Expected behavior**

Test passed.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
master head: 40b419d839a028348427fc0eab959f64119a32c0

items.title: Issues with non-wheel installation
items.body:
When installing unihandecode as a dependency, some files seem to not get built correctly.

Direct installation works:

``` sh
$ pip install --no-use-wheel unihandecode
Collecting unihandecode
Downloading Unihandecode-0.50.tar.gz (2.8MB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 2.8MB 220kB/s 
Installing collected packages: unihandecode
  Running setup.py install for unihandecode
Successfully installed unihandecode-0.50
$ python
Python 2.7.5+ (default, Feb 27 2014, 19:37:08) 
[GCC 4.8.1] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from unihandecode import Unihandecoder
>>> d = Unihandecoder(lang='zh')
>>> 
```

When using `setup.py develop` on a package that has unihandecode as a dependency, it doesn't seem to build properly:

``` sh
$ python setup.py develop
[...]
Searching for unihandecode>=0.50
Reading https://pypi.python.org/simple/unihandecode/
Best match: Unihandecode 0.50
Downloading https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/U/Unihandecode/Unihandecode-0.50.tar.gz#md5=4209841643219c5434852df47b056f2d
Processing Unihandecode-0.50.tar.gz
Writing /tmp/easy_install-7I5fyz/slugger-0.2.1/temp/easy_install-XqV15N/Unihandecode-0.50/setup.cfg
Running Unihandecode-0.50/setup.py -q bdist_egg --dist-dir /tmp/easy_install-7I5fyz/slugger-0.2.1/temp/easy_install-XqV15N/Unihandecode-0.50/egg-dist-tmp-oi2uFB
zip_safe flag not set; analyzing archive contents...

Installed /tmp/easy_install-7I5fyz/slugger-0.2.1/Unihandecode-0.50-py2.7.egg
[...]
$ python
Python 2.7.5+ (default, Feb 27 2014, 19:37:08) 
[GCC 4.8.1] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from unihandecode import Unihandecoder
>>> d = Unihandecoder(lang='zh')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/unihandecode/__init__.py", line 37, in __init__
  File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/unihandecode/unidecoder.py", line 75, in __init__
  File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/unihandecode/unidecoder.py", line 117, in _load_codepoints
  File "/home/marc/.virtualenvs/dj/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 951, in resource_stream
    self, resource_name
  File "/home/marc/.virtualenvs/dj/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 1406, in get_resource_stream
    return BytesIO(self.get_resource_string(manager, resource_name))
  File "/home/marc/.virtualenvs/dj/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 1409, in get_resource_string
    return self._get(self._fn(self.module_path, resource_name))
  File "/home/marc/.virtualenvs/dj/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 1486, in _get
    return self.loader.get_data(path)
IOError: [Errno 0] Error: 'unihandecode/unicodepoints.pickle.bz2'
```

A workaround (on an existing installation) is to remove the virtualenv's `Unihandecode-0.50-py2.7.egg` file, then install unihandecode against using the `--use-wheel` option.

I believe that this does every installation of unihandecode made using the `develop` command of `setup.py`.

items.title: pip install error
items.body:
``` python
ImportError: no module named nose
```

because of

``` python
import nose
```

in `setup.py` which is needed only in development mode.

Python 2.7, Unihandecode 0.45

items.title: Incomplete install via pip
items.body:
Hi,

when installing current release via pip package system, there are completely missing all *.pickle.bz2 files in destination dist-packages directory.  With easy_install is everything fine.

items.title: Remove unneccesary space in text end.
items.body: There is space character in output text end.

items.title: Feature request: Implementation for Unicode CLDR standard rule for transiliteration
items.body:
ICU support every languages in the world except CJKV Kanji/Hanji.

http://userguide.icu-project.org/transforms/general

ICU follows http://www.eki.ee/wgrs/ 

We should make compatibility with ICU conversion or link with ICU.

items.title: Problem with gdbm
items.body:
Ok, I tried using the newest .egg release (0.42).   Now I'm getting an exception when I initiate a Unihandecoder object:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/Volumes/Boxcryptor Classic/_Dev/EZGeo/main.py", line 55, in <module>
unihandecoder = Unihandecoder(lang)
File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Unihandecode-0.42-py2.7.egg/unihandecode/__init__.py", line 31, in __init__
self.decoder = Jadecoder()
File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Unihandecode-0.42-py2.7.egg/unihandecode/jadecoder.py", line 40, in __init__
self.kakasi = kakasi()
File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Unihandecode-0.42-py2.7.egg/unihandecode/pykakasi/kakasi.py", line 38, in __init__
self._conv["j"] = J2a()
File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Unihandecode-0.42-py2.7.egg/unihandecode/pykakasi/j2a.py", line 39, in __init__
self._jconv = J2H()
File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Unihandecode-0.42-py2.7.egg/unihandecode/pykakasi/j2h.py", line 46, in __init__
self._kanwa = kanwa()  
File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Unihandecode-0.42-py2.7.egg/unihandecode/pykakasi/kanwa.py", line 36, in __init__
self._kanwadict = dbm.open(dictpath,'r')
File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/anydbm.py", line 84, in open
mod = __import__(result)
ImportError: No module named gdbm
```

I think the anydbm module might be incorrectly detecting the type of database used for kanwadict2.db.  Did you change the db format when you updated the dictionary (https://github.com/miurahr/unihandecode/issues/8)?

I'm using Python 2.7.5 with Eclipse and PyDev on MacOS 10.8.4.

items.title: release 0.41
items.body:
- fix infinite loop bug
- document update
- upload egg on pypi.python.org

items.title: Infinite loop
items.body:
I'm using unihandecode version 0.40 for Python 2.7 with the updated kanwadict2.db file (from https://bugs.launchpad.net/calibre/+bug/780804).  

I'm trying to transliterate the following unicode:

```
from unihandecode import Unihandecoder

s = u'\u30d0\u30cb\u30fc\u3061\u3083\u3093\u3061\u306e\u30b7\u30e3\u30ef\u30fc\u30ce\u30ba\u30eb\u306e\u5148\u7aef'
u = Unihandecoder('ja')
print u.decode(s)
```

I'm getting caught in an infinite loop.

kanadict.utf8 is uncompleted now.

 We need upgrade dictionary.

items.title: Infinite loop at line 63 of kakasi.py

milestone.description: Fix infinite loop and update kanadit

items.body:
Now I have a (seemingly) working installation of unihandecode. However, the following code yields an infinite loop for me:

In [1]: import unihandecode
In [2]: jj = unihandecode.Unihandecoder(lang='ja')
In [3]: jj.decode(u"日本語ページへようこそ")

A keyboard interrupt shows it is in line 63 of /home/tastalian/Site/unihandecode/pykakasi/kakasi.pyc (which is indeed a "while True" loop).

items.title: Unpickling issue

milestone.description: Fix infinite loop and update kanadit

items.body:
Hi there,

There is a problem at line 17 of unihandecode/pykakasi/jisyo.py:

 17         (self._dict, self._len) = load(dict_pkl)

On my system, pickle.load only returns a dictionary, which yields an error here. However, after patching it to 

 17         self._dict = load(dict_pkl)
 18         self._len = len(self._dict)

it still does not work for me: running "python setup.py test" goes into an infinite loop... (And when I try to use Jadecoder() directly, it decodes u"日本語" into an empty string.)

Cheers,
—Tastalian

items.title: Pickled files

milestone.description: Fix infinite loop and update kanadit

items.body:
Hi there,

I have just cloned unihandecode and tried to install it on my machine. However, I needed three files that were not in the repository:
- itaijidict2.pickle
- kanadict2.pickle
- kanwadict2.db

I found itaijidict2.pickle and kanwadict2.db in another repository. As to kanadict2.pickle, I downloaded it from calibre.

It would be nice to have all required files in the repository.

Cheers,
—Tastalian
